alert.note: Alert for Alaska Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 02 at 3:59PM AKST until January 03 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...North winds 50 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph expected. * WHERE...Alaska Peninsula, including Sand Point and King Cove. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northerly winds will continue to increase after midnight through Monday morning for areas along the southern coast and south of the Alaska Peninsula. The highest winds are expected Monday morning, especially through bays and passes. Winds are expected to decrease Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
